Description: Short length of warp-faced, plain weave linen tape; Bars created by the use of warp threads of alternating colours; Warp: S spun undyed and pink linen, c.12tpc, order of threads in the warp is 2 undyed, 1 pink, 1u, 1p, 1u, 1p,1u, 1p, 3u; Weft: S spun undyed linen, c.3tpc; Edges: two simple selvedges and two ragged
Curator's comments: Unreg 21; Similar to EA37125 and EA74939; Used to secure burial wrappings; Found in 1988? in the Keeper's Office, previous location cupbaord O; From a burial of a pagan but non-Egyptian type?; Compare Khargha Oasis burials finds now in Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York, C. 300 AD; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (5.2.1991)
